content: Stadium in Toa Payoh, Singapore **Toa Payoh Stadium** was a [multi-purpose stadium](/wiki/Multi-purpose_stadium) in [Toa Payoh](/wiki/Toa_Payoh), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It was used mostly for [football](/wiki/Football_(soccer)) matches and was the home stadium of [Balestier Khalsa](/wiki/Balestier_Khalsa_FC). The stadium held 3,800 people. It was taken over by the then [Singapore Sports Council](/wiki/Singapore_Sports_Council) on 30 November 1973, and opened to the public on 1 March 1974. ## History The stadium was closed and demolished in August 2024, with the general vicinity being redeveloped as part of the Toa Payoh Integrated Development, with facilities such as a library, a much larger stadium, polyclinic and swimming complex by 2030. 1°19′49″N 103°51′10″E﻿ / ﻿1.330401°N 103.852891°E﻿ / 1.330401; 103.852891 ## Facility The stadium had a total [seating capacity](/wiki/Seating_capacity) of 3,964 people. The stadium consists of a soccer field, an 8-lane running track and a fitness corner. - [List of stadiums in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_stadiums_in_Singapore) This article about a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) sports venue is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Toa Payoh Stadium
